column1: To this the mason made no objection. So
column3: he was led by the stranger through various rough lanes and winding passages until they stopped before the portal of a house. The stranger then applied a key
column5: and opened what sounded like a ponderous door. They entered; the door was closed and bolted
column6: and the mason was conducted through an echoing corridor and a spacious hall to an interior part of the building. Here the bandage was removed from his eyes
column7: and he found himself in a court dimly lighted by a single lamp. In the center was the dry basin of an old fountain
column8: under which the stranger requested him to form a small vault
column9: bricks and mortar being at hand for the purpose. He worked all night
column10: but without finishing the job. Just before daybreak the stranger put a piece of gold into his hand
column12: conducted him back to his dwelling.
